eval_neg_texts: Correlation means one thing directly causes the other.
A control group is just extra people you do not need.
Opportunity cost is only about money spent.
Inflation makes everything more expensive because companies are greedy.
A hash function is just a way to hide data so no one can see it.
Airplanes stay up because engines are strong enough to push them.
Seasons change because the Earth is closer to the sun in summer.
If a result is statistically significant, it must be important.
Unsupervised learning is just supervised learning without a teacher but otherwise the same.
A stack and a queue are basically the same thing.
Vaccines work by giving you a mild version of the disease so you are done with it forever.
Steel ships float because steel is lighter than water.
Indexes are just extra copies of the data, so they always slow the database down.
The sky is blue because it reflects the ocean.
A good argument is the one that sounds most confident.
GPS works because satellites can see you directly.
Adding salt makes water colder in general, so it freezes later.
Renewable energy is always cheaper and has no downsides.
A refrigerator cools things by making cold air appear.
Models generalize when they memorize more training data.
eval_pos_texts: Correlation shows association, but causation requires a mechanism and ruling out confounders.
A control group isolates the effect by keeping all variables the same except the treatment.
Opportunity cost is the value of the best alternative you give up.
Inflation reduces purchasing power because the same money buys fewer goods.
A hash function maps input to a fixed-size output and is designed to be one-way.
Airplanes fly because lift from the wings balances weight when air flows over them.
Seasons are opposite because the Earth tilts, not because it is closer to the sun.
Statistical significance can be tiny in effect size, so practical impact still matters.
Supervised learning uses labeled data, while unsupervised learning finds patterns without labels.
A queue is FIFO and a stack is LIFO, which changes how data is accessed.
Vaccines train immune memory so the body responds faster on exposure.
Steel ships float because their overall density with enclosed air is less than water.
A database index speeds lookups at the cost of extra storage and write overhead.
The sky appears blue because shorter wavelengths scatter more in the atmosphere.
A good argument states claims, evidence, and reasoning, and addresses counterpoints.
GPS uses timing from multiple satellites to triangulate position.
Adding salt lowers freezing point by disrupting the formation of ice crystals.
Renewables trade variability for lower fuel costs and emissions.
A refrigerator removes heat by compressing and expanding refrigerant in a cycle.
Generalization improves when a model captures underlying structure rather than noise.
